material.mattext: The main difference between academic writing and normal writing is that academic writing
tries to be precise and unbiased
Which of the following is an example of a primary source?
Part of the main body in which the views of other writers on the topic are discussed is —------
Why use quotations in written work?
When the original words are yours
When the original words are not correct
These are ways of taking notes effectively except
Which of the following best describes the purpose of conventions of academic writing?
To make writing fun and entertaining
To produce writing that is clear, concise, formal, and objective
To include as many complicated words and ideas as possible
To express personal opinions without evidence
Who is the most important consideration for producing a piece of academic work?
The writer's personal preferences and opinions
The writer's target audience or readers
The writer's university professors and instructors
How can a writer achieve clarity in their academic writing?
By using complex and technical language
By providing a broad understanding of the topic
By avoiding any references to previous research
By using informal language and slang terms
An academic writer is expected to be
What is the purpose of using lead-in words or phrases in an essay?
To confuse the reader and make the essay more challenging
To create a logical flow and transition between points in the essay
To include personal opinions and biases in the essay
To make the essay longer and more detailed
What should an academic writer consider when determining the level of formality in their writing?
The cultural background of their audience
The specific discipline and context of their writing
The current trends in popular writing styles
It is not necessary for writing a well-structured paragraph
What should academic writing be free from?
An author ___________ a relationship between variables based on the data.
An essay about a writer's work would MOST likely use which of the following phrases to connect a piece of evidence from the text to a larger point being made?
The advantages of studying abroad are numerous, _______ it does require getting accustomed to a new culture and language.
Air pollution has serious negative consequences for public health and the environment. ______, governments should enact stricter regulations on industry emissions.
These names can be used for a writer of an essay except?
Which transition is used to introduce an opposing viewpoint?
Most panellists agreed with the conclusion. _________, one member had doubts.
We started down one path, ______, we found a better solution along the way.
The study _____ a correlation but the authors call for further investigation.
The text ______ a relationship between two variables but does not prove causation.
Both proposals had merit but needed refinement. _____, we agreed to rework the proposals.
We discussed various options and their pros and cons. ____, we decided on the best solution.
The committee debated the various options all morning. ______, a solution was being negotiated behind the scenes.
What is the term used for the logical and orderly connection of ideas in academic writing?
One primary characteristic of an academic work is that it presents a
Which of these statements is true about academic writing?
The style is very flexible and context doesn’t matter
There is a single correct style that applies to all disciplines
Different contexts require different levels of formality
The style doesn’t vary between academic disciplines
Which resources are helpful for learning academic writing styles?
Why is it important to learn discipline-specific writing practice?
Writing practices vary from one discipline to another
To show that you do not know how to write
Which of these do you look out for when following writing practices?
Good academic writing needs all of:
What should you never do when writing an essay?
Provide quotes that are not related to the main topic
Which of these are parts of a paragraph
When we use quotations, we should:
use inverted commas around the ’exact’ words of the author.
place the ‘exact’ words of an author in inverted commas and supply a citation with a page number.
paraphrase carefully and use a citation.
summarise what the author said and use a citation with page numbers
the place of publication of the source.
the page numbers of the source.
the full bibliographic details required for the particular type of source that is being referenced.
the authors, the year, the title of the source, the place of publication and the publisher.
What is the purpose of the writing process?
To organise ideas and write them in a structured manner
To entertain the audience with creative writing
To copy and paste information from sources
To skip the planning stage and directly start writing
What is the first step in the writing process?
Editing and revising the written work
Proofreading for spelling and grammar errors
What is the importance of invention and prewriting in the writing process?
It helps in generating ideas and organising them
It ensures proper grammar and sentence structure
It helps in formatting the document correctly
When writing, it is inappropriate to use personal experiences to generate ideas
One way to organise your thoughts is by:
Once you begin writing, you need to
Be open minded for more ideas
Refuse to make changes to your work
Stick to what does not work
Invention of ideas can be achieved through:
Good writing skills are only important in an academic setting
